FLM200.name: Film Collective
FLM200.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year

FLM211.name: Documentary History and Theory
FLM211.description: Documentary history and theory form its origins to the present.
FLM211.restrictions: Open to students in the School of Journalism or in the Department of Media and Information or in the Department of Writing, Rhetoric and American Cultures or in the Documentary Studies Specialization or in the Film Studies major.

FLM230.name: Introduction to Film
FLM230.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FLM230.description: Basic concepts and techniques of film analysis and criticism.
FLM230.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

FLM255.name: Stars and Directors
FLM255.description: Survey of individual film directors and/or stars.
FLM255.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

FLM260.name: Introduction to Digital Film and Emergent Media
FLM260.description: Introduction to digital film and emergent media production.

FLM300.name: History of Film to Midcentury
FLM300.description: Traditions of film and media history from cinema’s beginnings to 1945.
FLM300.prerequisite: FLM 230 or concurrently or approval of department

FLM301.name: History of Film after Midcentury
FLM301.description: Traditions of film and media history from 1945 to the present.
FLM301.prerequisite: FLM 230 or concurrently or approval of department

FLM311.name: Introduction to Documentary Production
FLM311.description: Introduction to documentary production using accessible and affordable digital technology.
FLM311.restrictions: Open to students in the Documentary Production Minor.

FLM334.name: Introduction to Screenwriting (W)
FLM334.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FLM334.description: Basic elements of screenwriting. Dramatic action, exposition, plotting, characterization and dialogue, finalizing and marketing the script.
FLM334.prerequisite: (FLM 230 or concurrently) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

FLM335.name: Film Directing
FLM335.description: Concepts and techniques for directing in styles most associated with the art of film. Studies of innovative film directors. Skills of film directing, including script and shot breakdown. Directing actors and crew. Directing on location.
FLM335.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Fiction Filmmaking Minor.

FLM336.name: Aesthetics of Film Editing
FLM336.description: Aesthetics, styles, techniques, and traditions of film editing, in theory and practice.

FLM350.name: National and Transnational Cinemas
FLM350.description: Traditions of national and transnational cinemas.

FLM355.name: Studies in Film Genres
FLM355.description: Films studied by genre such as musicals and film noir and by movements such as the new wave and the avant-garde.

FLM380.name: Classical Film and Media Theory
FLM380.description: Theories of film aesthetics, meaning, and spectatorship from cinema's inception to the 1970s. Film's intersection with theories of the other arts including theatre, painting, and photography.

FLM381.name: Contemporary Film and Media Theory
FLM381.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FLM381.description: Theories of film aesthetics, meaning, and spectatorship from the 1970s to the present. Film's intersection with theories of new technologies and artistic forms.

FLM400.name: Seminar in the History of Film (W)
FLM400.description: Selected movements or traditions in film history. Silent film, studio film, New Wave, or British film.
FLM400.prerequisite: ((FLM 230) and completion of Tier I writing requirement) and ((FLM 300 or concurrently) or (FLM 301 or concurrently) or approval of department)

FLM411.name: Collaborative Documentary Design and Production (W)
FLM411.description: Design and development of documentaries in a team setting using video and audio, still photography, web design, and print media. Participation in a production cycle including idea generation, research, design, production, and distribution.
FLM411.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
FLM411.restrictions: Open to students in the Documentary Production Minor.

FLM434.name: Advanced Screenwriting (W)
FLM434.description: Advanced workshop in writing screenplays. Reading and analysis of published screenplays. Attention to film production.
FLM434.prerequisite: (FLM 334 or approval of department) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

FLM435A.name: Creating the Fiction Film I
FLM435A.description: Creation of a short film, including scripting, conceptualization and planning, shooting, and rough editing.
FLM435A.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Fiction Filmmaking Minor or approval of department.

FLM435B.name: Creating the Fiction Film II (W)
FLM435B.description: Finishing a short film, including fine editing, color correction, sound design, and foley work. Developing web promotion, marketing strategies, and distribution.
FLM435B.prerequisite: (FLM 435A or approval of department) and Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
FLM435B.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Fiction Filmmaking Minor or approval of department.

FLM450.name: Studies in Ethnic Film
FLM450.description: Film traditions and/or film makers studied from the perspective of a particular ethnic group, such as Native American, Chicano/a, Latina/o, Jewish, or other American ethnic groups.

FLM451.name: Studies in Postcolonial Cinema
FLM451.description: Films of the Postcolonial World, including major directors and trends from Africa, Asia, and Latin America.

FLM452.name: Studies in Film, Gender, and Sexuality
FLM452.description: Study of films by women and about women, gender, masculinity, or sexuality.

FLM455.name: Experimental Film and Media
FLM455.description: History and theory of experimental film and media practices.

FLM460.name: Seminar in Digital Film and Emergent Media (W)
FLM460.description: Seminar emphasizing the intersections of the theoretical and practical applications of digital film and other emergent media.
FLM460.prerequisite: ((FLM 230 or concurrently) or approval of department) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

FLM480.name: Seminar in Film and Media Theory (W)
FLM480.description: Advanced topics in theories of film aesthetics, meaning, and spectatorship. Film intersection with theories of the other arts and media, politics, and identity.
FLM480.prerequisite: ((FLM 230) and completion of Tier I writing requirement) and (FLM 380 or FLM 381)

FLM489H.name: Senior Honors Independent Project
FLM489H.description: A substantial critical essay, a comparable essay arising from an internship, or a similar project. Writing supervised by a faculty adviser.
FLM489H.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Honors College. Approval of department.

FLM490.name: Independent Study
FLM490.description: Special projects arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.
FLM490.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors. Approval of department.

FLM491.name: Special Topics in Film Studies
FLM491.description: Intensive study of a director, topic, or critical issue.

FLM492H.name: Honors Seminar in Film Studies
FLM492H.description: Specific topic in Film Studies for Honors students. Individual and group research. Discussion of student papers.
FLM492H.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Honors College or approval of department.

FLM493.name: Film Studies Internship
FLM493.description: Supervised pre-professional field experience in Film Studies.

FLM499.name: Senior Thesis Research (W)
FLM499.description: Faculty-supervised research project that demonstrates ability to do independent research and submit or present a major paper.
FLM499.prerequisite: (FLM 230) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
FLM499.restrictions: Open to seniors. Approval of department.

FLM800.name: Methods in Film Studies
FLM800.description: Foundations in film and media analysis, research methods, and pedagogy.

FLM810.name: Seminar in Film Studies
FLM810.description: Current topics in the discipline of film studies.

FLM820.name: Topics in Film Studies
FLM820.description: Seminar constructed around a topic or critical problem in film analysis, theory, history, or criticism.

FLM855.name: Interdisciplinary Topics in Film Studies
FLM855.description: Topics in film studies that engage other disciplines and fields through historical, cultural, and formal content.
